text: <@U37F5PG64|anton> has joined the channel

Hi guys, how can I clone from gerrit using ssh, 
I've setup everything including LinuxFID and the ssh key on gerrit, but still got `Permission denied` 
The http way with password works, but it can't be used to submit patch right?
<@U2Z3ABG7N|vibhu> has joined the channel

hey guys - i am using v0.6 for fabric and running the vagrant vm. I have built the peer but when i try make membersrvc, i get an error as below: 
vagrant@hyperledger-devenv:v0.2.1-af0cd3e:~$ make membersrvc
make: *** No rule to make target 'membersrvc'.  Stop.
Please hel
<@U2Z3ABG7N> two comments
1) devenv v0.2.1 is associated with mainline:  I would suggest you exit, vagrant destroy, vagrant up within v0.6 branch to ensure maximum compatiblity
2) it looks like you are in the home dir
try "cd $GOPATH/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric" before the make, and I suspect you will have better luck

<@U0KPFAZNF> thanks for the tips - i tried comment #2 and got he following:
vagrant@hyperledger-devenv:v0.2.1-af0cd3e:/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric$ make membersrvc
make: *** No rule to make target 'membersrvc'.  Stop.
df ?
also: ls ?

vagrant@hyperledger-devenv:v0.2.1-af0cd3e:/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric$ df
Filesystem                                   1K-blocks     Used Available Use% Mounted on
udev                                           2015520        0   2015520   0% /dev

/dev/sda1                                     40636768  5542808  33006692  15% /

opt_gopath_src_github.com_hyperledger_fabric 112548560 32884592  79663968  30% /opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric
tmpfs                                           404664        0    404664   0% /run/user/1000
vagrant@hyperledger-devenv:v0.2.1-af0cd3e:/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric$ ls
bddtests  devenv  examples  gotools  Makefile    msp      proposals  README.md        tools               vendor
build     docs    flogging  images   metadata    orderer  protos     scripts          TravisCI_Readme.md
core      events  gossip    LICENSE  mkdocs.yml  peer     pub        settings.gradle  unit-test
$ git rev-parse HEAD

vagrant@hyperledger-devenv:v0.2.1-af0cd3e:/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric$ git rev-parse HEAD
af0cd3e018f928a685035cd27ebb22f3497f4195
is that a private commit?
no i cloned the <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric.git> and started vagrant vm from devenv, which is not v0.6 but i can try with that
im confused:  af0cd3e018f isnt appearing in my tree..maybe I am just behind
oh, i know what it is
you said you were using v0.6, but it doesnt appear that you are
what made you think you were on v0.6?
im guessing here, but I think the issue is that you checked out /built master
membersrvc doesnt exist on master (it was moved to fabric-cop.git)

<@U0KPFAZNF> more to add to the confusion - i downloaded the zip file directly .. fabric0.6 and started vagrant up from there, this is what i got  ----
==> default: Running provisioner: shell...
    default: Running: inline script
==> default: stdin: is not a tty
==> default: ++ export DOCKER_STORAGE_BACKEND=
==> default: ++ DOCKER_STORAGE_BACKEND=
==> default: ++ cd /hyperledger/devenv
==> default: ++ ./setup.sh
==> default: fatal: Not a git repository (or any parent up to mount point /hyperledger)
==> default: Stopping at filesystem boundary (GIT_DISCOVERY_ACROSS_FILESYSTEM not set).
The SSH command responded with a non-zero exit status. Vagrant
assumes that this means the command failed. The output for this command
should be in the log above. Please read the output to determine what
went wrong.
yeah, I think I know what that issue is
whats happening is that the code is assuming you are working from a git tree...it should be fixed, but as a work around you can fake it
in the place that you unpacked the tarball: git init && git add . && git commit -a
then, cd devenv && vagrant destroy && vagrant up
ok u mean under /src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric-0.6 local folder
whereever you downloaded it
er, unpacked it, i should say
IIUC, this is /src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric-0.6 for you, so run the git commands from that top-level dir

bhan@bhanubuntu:~/src/gocode/src/github.com/hyperledger$ git init && git add . && git commit -a
Initialized empty Git repository in /home/bhan/src/gocode/src/github.com/hyperledger/.git/
Use "fg" to return to nano.

[1]+  Stopped                 git commit -a

bhan@bhanubuntu:~/src/gocode/src/github.com/hyperledger$ git init && git add . && git commit -a
Initialized empty Git repository in /home/bhan/src/gocode/src/github.com/hyperledger/.git/
Use "fg" to return to nano.

[1]+  Stopped                 git commit -a
I think its waiting for a commit message
you can either edit one in your chosen $EDITOR, or use "git commit -a -m 'import v0.6'" instead
k i have done the commit, will run the vagrant command in an hour ... have to run to a meeting :disappointed:
but thanks for the nuggets of info ... ill be back
<@U0KPFAZNF> thank u so much .. the 0.6 vagrant vm is correctly up and running, i will have to test my deploy and invoke chaincode next to ensure all working but looking good so far!!
